DOC.brief_summary: This study is to examine the hypothesis that administration of RDEA3170 to Japanese patients with gout or asymptomatic hyperuricemia in doses of 5 mg, 7.5 mg, 10 mg, 12.5 mg and 15 mg once daily, respectively will result in greater reduction of sUA compared to placebo.
DOC.brief_title: Phase II Dose Finding Study of RDEA3170 Versus Placebo in Japanese Patients With Gout or Asymptomatic Hyperuricemia
DOC.criteria: Subject meets any of the following criteria and with sUA ≤10.0 mg/dL: 1. sUA level of >7.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline with gout; 2. sUA level of ≥8.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline without gout but with complications (hypertension, ischemic heart disease, diabetes, metabolic syndrome); 3. sUA level of ≥9.0 mg/dL at 7 days prior to baseline without gout and complications. Subject with an acute gout flare that has not resolved at least 14 days prior to the baseline visit. Subject has a history or suspicion of kidney stones. Subject has an estimated creatinine clearance <60 mL/min calculated by the Cockcroft Gault formula Subject is receiving strong or moderate CYP3A inhibitors
